memberdef.definition: typedef uint8_t(* attsReadCback_t) (dmConnId_t connId, uint16_t handle, uint8_t operation, uint16_t offset, attsAttr_t *pAttr)
memberdef.argsstring: )(dmConnId_t connId, uint16_t handle, uint8_t operation, uint16_t offset, attsAttr_t *pAttr)
memberdef.name: attsReadCback_t

briefdescription.para: Attribute group read callback.

detaileddescription.para: This is the attribute server read callback. It is executed on an attribute read operation if bitmask ATTS_SET_READ_CBACK is set in the settings field of the attribute structure. For a read operation, if the operation is successful the function must set pAttr->pValue to the data to be read. In addition, if the attribute is variable length then pAttr->pLen must be set as well.

simplesect.para: status of the operation. ATT_SUCCESS if successful.

memberdef.definition: typedef uint8_t(* attsWriteCback_t) (dmConnId_t connId, uint16_t handle, uint8_t operation, uint16_t offset, uint16_t len, uint8_t *pValue, attsAttr_t *pAttr)
memberdef.argsstring: )(dmConnId_t connId, uint16_t handle, uint8_t operation, uint16_t offset, uint16_t len, uint8_t *pValue, attsAttr_t *pAttr)
memberdef.name: attsWriteCback_t

briefdescription.para: Attribute group write callback.

detaileddescription.para: This is the attribute server write callback. It is executed on an attribute write operation if bitmask ATTS_SET_WRITE_CBACK is set in the settings field of the attribute structure.

simplesect.para: status of operation. ATT_SUCCESS if successful.

memberdef.definition: typedef uint8_t(* attsAuthorCback_t) (dmConnId_t connId, uint8_t permit, uint16_t handle)
memberdef.name: attsAuthorCback_t

briefdescription.para: ATTS authorization callback type.

detaileddescription.para: This callback function is executed when a read or write operation occurs and the security field of an attribute structure is set to ATTS_PERMIT_READ_AUTHORIZ or ATTS_PERMIT_WRITE_AUTHORIZ respectively.

parameterdescription.para: Set to ATTS_PERMIT_WRITE for a writre operation or ATTS_PERMIT_READ for a read operation.

simplesect.para: status of the operation. ATT_SUCCESS if successful, else if failure the ATT_ERR_AUTH is typically returned.

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* attsCsfWriteCback_t) (dmConnId_t connId, uint8_t changeAwareState, uint8_t *pCsf)
memberdef.name: attsCsfWriteCback_t

briefdescription.para: ATTS client supported features write callback type.

detaileddescription.para: This callback function is executed when the client supported features record for this client has been updated.

parameterdescription.para: The state of awareness to a change, see ::attClientAwareStates.
Pointer to the client supported features value.

briefdescription.para: ATTS client characteristic configuration callback.

detaileddescription.para: Client characteristic configuration callback. This function is executed when a CCCD value changes. This happens when a peer device writes a new value to the CCCD or when a CCCD table is initialized by calling AttsCccInitTable.

briefdescription.para: Attribute group.
Initialize ATT server.
Initialize ATT server for indications/notifications.
Initialize ATT server for data signing.
Register an authorization callback with the attribute server.
Add an attribute group to the attribute server.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to an attribute group structure.

briefdescription.para: Remove an attribute group from the attribute server.

parameterdescription.para: Start handle of attribute group to be removed.

briefdescription.para: Calculate database hash from the GATT database.
Create hash from the database string.

simplesect.para: true if successful, false if not.

briefdescription.para: Set an attribute value in the attribute server.
Get an attribute value in the attribute server.

simplesect.para: This function returns the attribute length in pLen and a pointer to the attribute value in pValue.

briefdescription.para: Set the LTK availability on a given connection.

parameterdescription.para: Whether LTK is available for connection.

memberdef.argsstring: (dmConnId_t connId, uint16_t handle, uint16_t valueLen, uint8_t *pValue)

briefdescription.para: Send an attribute protocol Handle Value Indication.

memberdef.argsstring: (dmConnId_t connId, uint16_t handle, uint16_t valueLen, uint8_t *pValue)

briefdescription.para: Send an attribute protocol Handle Value Notification.

memberdef.argsstring: (dmConnId_t connId, uint16_t handle, uint16_t valueLen, uint8_t *pValue)
memberdef.name: AttsHandleValueIndZeroCpy

briefdescription.para: Send an attribute protocol Handle Value Indication without copying the attribute value data.

detaileddescription.para: Note: attribute value buffer 'pValue' must be allocated with AttMsgAlloc().

memberdef.argsstring: (dmConnId_t connId, uint16_t handle, uint16_t valueLen, uint8_t *pValue)
memberdef.name: AttsHandleValueNtfZeroCpy

briefdescription.para: Send an attribute protocol Handle Value Notification without copying the attribute value data.

detaileddescription.para: Note: attribute value buffer 'pValue' must be allocated with AttMsgAlloc().

briefdescription.para: Register the utility service for managing client characteristic configuration descriptors. This function is typically called once on system initialization.

Initialize the client characteristic configuration descriptor value table for a connection. The table is initialized with the values from pCccTbl. If pCccTbl is NULL the table will be initialized to zero.

detaileddescription.para: This function must be called when a connection is established or when a device is bonded.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the descriptor value array. The length of the array must equal the value of setLen passed to AttsCccRegister().

briefdescription.para: Clear and deallocate the client characteristic configuration descriptor value table for a connection. This function must be called when a connection is closed.
Get the value of a client characteristic configuration descriptor by its index. If not found, return zero.

parameterdescription.para: Index of descriptor in CCC descriptor handle table.

briefdescription.para: Set the value of a client characteristic configuration descriptor by its index.

parameterdescription.para: Index of descriptor in CCC descriptor handle table.

briefdescription.para: Check if a client characteristic configuration descriptor is enabled and if the characteristic's security level has been met.

parameterdescription.para: Index of descriptor in CCC descriptor handle table.

simplesect.para: Value of the descriptor if security level is met, otherwise zero.

briefdescription.para: Check if a client characteristic configuration descriptor is enabled and if the characteristic's security level has been met.

simplesect.para: Value of the descriptor if security level is met, otherwise zero.

briefdescription.para: Get number of CCC entries in table.

simplesect.para: Number of CCC entries in table.

briefdescription.para: Get the ATT bearer slot associated with the write callback. For use with ATT_RSP_PENDING.

simplesect.para: This function should only be called within the context of the write callback.

briefdescription.para: Send a response to a pending write request. For use with ATT_RSP_PENDING.

simplesect.para: When a higher layer returns ATT_RSP_PENDING to an ATT write callback indicating the response status is pending, the higher layer must subsequently call this function with the status of the write request.

briefdescription.para: Set the peer's data signing key on this connection. This function is typically called from the ATT connection callback when the connection is established. The caller is responsible for maintaining the memory that contains the key.

parameterdescription.para: Whether CSRK was received on authenticated connection.

briefdescription.para: Set the peer's sign counter on this connection. This function is typically called from the ATT connection callback when the connection is established. ATT maintains the value of the sign counter internally and sets the value when a signed packet is successfully received.

Get the current value peer's sign counter on this connection. This function is typically called from the ATT connection callback when the connection is closed so the application can store the sign counter for use on future connections.
Initialize ATTS client supported features module.
Initialize the client supported features for a connection.

parameterdescription.para: The state of awareness to a change in the database.
Pointer to the client supported features value to cache. NULL or buffer of length ATT_CSF_LEN.

memberdef.argsstring: (dmConnId_t connId, uint16_t offset, uint16_t valueLen, uint8_t *pValue)
memberdef.name: AttsCsfWriteFeatures

briefdescription.para: GATT write of client supported feature characteristic value.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to client's supported features characteristic value.

simplesect.para: ATT_SUCCESS is successful, ATT_ERR_VALUE_NOT_ALLOWED if any supported features are flipped from 1 to 0.

briefdescription.para: Get client supported feature record.

parameterdescription.para: Output parameter for client supported features buffer.

briefdescription.para: Get client state of awareness to a change in the database.
Update a client's state of awareness to a change in the database.

parameterdescription.para: DM connection ID. if DM_CONN_ID_NONE, sets the state for all connected clients.
The state of awareness to a change, see attClientAwareStates.

simplesect.para: A callback to application is not needed as it is expected the caller (i.e. the application) will have updated all persistent records prior to calling this function.

briefdescription.para: Register callback.

parameterdescription.para: Application callback for when client supported features record is updated.

briefdescription.para: Get the ATT bearer slot associated with the read callback. For use with ATT_RSP_PENDING.

simplesect.para: This function can only be called from the read callback.

memberdef.argsstring: (dmConnId_t connId, uint16_t handle, uint8_t status, uint8_t *pData, uint16_t len)
memberdef.name: AttsContinueReadReq

briefdescription.para: Send a response to a pending read request. For use with ATT_RSP_PENDING.

simplesect.para: When a higher layer returns ATT_RSP_PENDING to an ATT read callback indicating the response status is pending, the higher layer must subsequently call this function with the status of the read request.

briefdescription.para: Initialize the Enhanced ATT Server.

simplesect.para: EattInit must be called after the ATT task is created and before calling EattsInit and/or EattcInit.

description.para: Settings that may be set on each attribute.

detaileddescription.para: Set if the UUID is 128 bits in length
Set if the group callback is executed when this attribute is written by a client device
Set if the group callback is executed when this attribute is read by a client device
Set if the attribute has a variable length
Set if writes are allowed with an offset
Set if the attribute is a client characteristic configuration descriptor
Set if signed writes are allowed
Set if signed writes are required if link is not encrypted

description.para: Permissions used to describe a attribute's security setting. These values can be set in any combination.

detaileddescription.para: Set if attribute can be read
Set if attribute read requires authentication
Set if attribute read requires authorization
Set if attribute read requires encryption
Set if attribute can be written
Set if attribute write requires authentication
Set if attribute write requires authorization
Set if attribute write requires encryption
